post: In a time of great civil discord, it is important to continue to find ways to create a structure for open communication and civil discourse in our classrooms. Discover ways to connect with our founding principles and civic virtues to build community in our classrooms and learn to practice civil discourse to strengthen our communities. Join us for our Civil Discourse Educator Summit on May 3rd from 8:00 AM-3:00 PM PDT in Reno, Nevada. This Summit will start with a civil discourse workshop to help 6-12 teachers create an environment that fosters student deliberation. Register today!  https://lnkd.in/esUuq37p.

High school students, want to challenge yourself? Founding Forward and the Bill of Rights Institute invite students entering grades 10-12 to from across the nation gather to strengthen their debate skills and deepen their civic knowledge. The 5-day session will take place in historic Valley Forge, PA. Students will also have the opportunity to participate in a day trip through Philadelphia. We can't wait to see you there! Register now,  https://lnkd.in/erA2KXha

Calling all Michigan teachers! Join us for an engaging, one-day seminar entitled "Government & Politics: Exploring the Foundations and Operation of Representative Government." This seminar will utilize the new Government and Politics curriculum from the Bill of Rights Institute, centering discussions and activities around the theme of America 250. Additional Details: - Attendees will receive a $150 stipend. - Continental breakfast and lunch will be provided. - BRI will provide a certificate of attendance for 6 contact hours. - A computer is required for this program. Through thought-provoking discussions and hands-on activities, educators will explore the historical context and contemporary relevance of these principles, fostering a richer appreciation for the complexities of American governance. Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your knowledge and connect with others who share a passion for civic education! Register now  https://lnkd.in/eFwYra_e.

Are you a student looking to showcase your service-based project? Are you making a difference in your community? You could win up to $2,000 for your project in the MyImpact Challenge Utah State Civic Fair on April 29, 2025. MyImpact Challenge is a civic engagement contest that promotes and fosters a robust understanding of citizenship to get students active in their communities now! You must submit: Principles Essay – A 1,200-word essay on how you project advances Founding principles and civic virtues Project Report – A report of up to 2,000 words on the projects inspiration, planning, and execution. Includes at least two examples of the impact on your community. Multimedia – Photographic or video documentation of project that shows a tangible impact. Register by April 14th – dont wait! Enter today.  https://lnkd.in/eDhK6hzP.

April is National Financial Literacy Month! The Bill of Rights Institute collaborated with Hoover Institution, Stanford University to create the Building Blocks of Progress curriculum in 2022. This multimedia resource explores the intersection of economics and civics, and covers the role of individuals, government, and economic principles in creating a free society. Find all lessons here:  https://lnkd.in/eUqgEpjP. This year, the Bill of Rights Institute has been hard at work to ensure we are on track to reach 100,000 teachers by our nations' 250th birthday in 2026. But we've also been busy trying to answer the question: how do you create a lasting impact on the future generation of leaders? Bill of Rights Institute Vice President of Development Anthony Simone discusses the impact of supporting BRIs work in classrooms and communities nationwide, and the ways in which the Institute equips students with fundamental skills to become engaged citizens and effective employees and leaders.
